column4: when installing ubuntu with wubi and i choose my external hard drive (wich has already some files and folders on it) the hard drive won't get overwritten,will it?
it shouldnt... though i wouldnt do it that way, or suggest using wubi.. or installing an OS without backing up whats already there
you get a bigger "fake" hard drive
the best would be *not* using wubi... if you are asking if 30gb's is enough.. that depends, but it should be a good start
